summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Jeffrey Epstein with one count of sex trafficking conspiracy and one count of sex trafficking of minors. It details a scheme from approximately 2002 to 2005 where Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach, using a network of employees and victim-recruiters to facilitate the abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors for sexually exploiting dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida from approximately 2002 to 2005.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and presented the indictment.

connections.description: Epstein directed Employee-1, a New York-based employee, to communicate with victims via phone to arrange sexual encounters at the New York Residence.
Epstein arranged for Employee-2 to contact victims to schedule sexual encounters at the Palm Beach Residence, including calls made from New York to Florida.
Employee-3, an assistant, placed phone calls to schedule sexual encounters for Epstein with minor victims at the Palm Beach Residence.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-1 at the New York Residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls. He asked her age and she answered truthfully.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-2 at the Palm Beach Residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-3 at the Palm Beach Residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls. He asked her age and she answered truthfully.

events.title: Beginning of Sex Trafficking Scheme
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein began enticing and recruiting dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him at his New York and Florida residences.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1 and Scheduling Call
events.description: Epstein enticed and recruited Minor Victim-1. Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a phone call to Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-2 and Scheduling Call
events.description: Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed a phone call to Minor Victim-2 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts at the Palm Beach Residence.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3 and Scheduling Calls
events.description: Epstein enticed and recruited Minor Victim-3. Both Employee-2 and Employee-3 placed phone calls to Minor Victim-3 to schedule appointments for paid sex acts at the Palm Beach Residence.

locations: Manhattan, New York (specifically the Upper East Side, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Palm Beach, Florida (referred to as the 'Palm Beach Residence')
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (specifically identified as a forfeitable property owned by Maple, Inc.)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors for exploiting dozens of girls, some as young as 14, from approximately 2002 to 2005.
Epstein operated a network using employees (referred to as Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to schedule encounters and victim-recruiters to bring new minors to his homes in New York and Florida.
The indictment alleges Epstein knew the victims were underage, as some told him their age directly, and he paid hundreds of dollars in cash after each sexual encounter.
The U.S. seeks forfeiture of specific property, including Epstein's mansion at 9 East 71st Street in New York, owned by Maple, Inc.
The document references three specific minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) and details their repeated abuse and recruitment of others.
